claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.
explanation: The figure contains four vaccine groups (Fluzone IIV4, Fluarix IIV4, ccIIV4, and RIV4) comparing geometric mean ratios of egg versus cell-grown virus titers at 1 month post-vaccination (panels A and B) and the proportion of subjects with ≥4-fold reduced titers to egg-adapted epitopes (panels C and D) across two age cohorts (18–44 years and 45–64 years). Error bars, 95% confidence intervals, and p-values are displayed for some comparisons. The figure depicts antibody response ratios and reductions against egg-adapted epitopes for four vaccine types, but it does not provide any data on HA antigen content or explicitly link a 3× HA dose to greater immunogenicity. Therefore, it does not support the claim. Note: The image is focused on serological response differences and does not address antigen dosage or content; resolution is sufficient to conclude absence of HA content information.
